alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Nye County; Northwestern Nye County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 1:45PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lander, northwestern Nye and southwestern Eureka Counties through 215 PM PDT... At 141 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a group of strong thunderstorm across southern Lander and north-central Nye Counties. Storms are expected to impact Highway 50 from New Pass Summit in Lander County, east through Austin and Hickison Summit. Storms will likely reach into southeastern Eureka County. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hickison Summit, Gillman Springs, Kingston, Austin, Little Fish Lake Valley, Monitor Valley, Table Mountain, Antelope Peak, Bob Scott Summit, Railroad Pass and Reese River Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Nye County; Northwestern Nye County
